questions.text: Calculate the area of a circle with radius 7 cm. Give your answer to 1 decimal place.
Find the coordinates of the midpoint of the line joining the points (3, -2) and (7, 6).

marking_schemes.text:
3x² - 15x + 2x - 10 = 3x² - 13x - 10 (2 marks)
Correct expansion: 1 mark
Correct simplification: 1 mark

6x² - 15x = 3x(2x - 5) (2 marks)
Common factor of 3x: 1 mark
Correct factorisation: 1 mark

4(2x - 3) = 3(x + 5)
8x - 12 = 3x + 15
8x - 3x = 15 + 12
5x = 27
x = 5.4 (3 marks)
Correct expansion: 1 mark
Correct collection of terms: 1 mark
Correct solution: 1 mark

Area = πr²
Area = π × 7²
Area = π × 49
Area = 153.9 cm² (2 marks)
Correct substitution: 1 mark
Correct answer with units: 1 mark

Midpoint = ((x₁ + x₂)/2, (y₁ + y₂)/2)
Midpoint = ((3 + 7)/2, (-2 + 6)/2)
Midpoint = (5, 2) (2 marks)
Correct method: 1 mark
Correct coordinates: 1 mark
